function.name: create_ticket
function.description: Creates a support ticket in Zendesk or Salesforce. Use this when a customer issue needs to be tracked and resolved by the support team.

priority.description: Ticket priority level. P0=critical, P1=high, P2=medium, P3=low, P4=informational

attachments.description: Array of attachment URLs or file references

function.name: post_social
function.description: Posts a message to social media platforms (Twitter/X, Facebook). Use this to respond to public complaints or announce service updates during crises.

message.description: Message to post. Must be under 280 characters for Twitter/X.

in_reply_to_id.description: Optional: ID of the post/tweet this is replying to

attachments.description: Optional: Array of media URLs to attach

dry_run.description: If true, validate message but don't actually post. Use for testing.

function.name: notify_ops
function.description: Sends notifications to operations teams via Slack and PagerDuty. Use this to escalate critical incidents to on-call engineers.

priority.description: Incident priority. P0=critical outage, P1=high impact, P2=medium impact

links.description: Array of relevant URLs (status page, ticket links, dashboards)

function.name: fetch_kb
function.description: Searches the knowledge base for solutions, documentation, or known issues. Use this to find answers before responding to customers.

function.name: ingest_event
function.description: Logs an event to the data lake for audit, analytics, and compliance. Use this to record all AI decisions, tool calls, and outcomes.

data.description: Event data payload (can contain any relevant fields)

metadata.description: Additional metadata (model versions, timestamps, user info)

function.name: social_monitor
function.description: Monitors social media platforms for mentions, hashtags, or trending topics related to the company. Use this to detect emerging crises.

keywords.description: Keywords or hashtags to search for

since.description: ISO timestamp for time range start (e.g., '2025-01-20T10:00:00Z')
